climbs.name: Yam Crack
climbs.fa: probably J Erickson on a solo binge

content.description:
This is a brief, crack climb found on the Bubble just L of Cold Sweat.  It's probably been done before but it's not in R Rossiter's Boulder Climbs North or Flatirons guidebooks.  Gave it a name because unknown crack sounded boring.  It can serve as a way to get a TR on Cold Sweat, a way to get the blood flowing, or just a pleasant, if brief, romp.

Find this on the WSW face of The Bubble, which lies just W of N Dinosaur Egg.  Approach via NCAR to the Mesa Trail, S to Bear Canyon Trail, up (N) the gully between the 2nd and 3rd strata.  If you back up from N Dinosaur Egg to examine the route Cloud Walker, you'll back right into the E face of The Bubble.

A combination of jams and large face holds allow this slightly-overhanging, R-leaning crack to go at a moderate grade.  Tape is not necessary.  There is a 10-15 ft traverse R to the anchors of Cold Sweat (2 cold shuts) as the crack peters out.  Rap the route.  35 ft.

It is probably equivalent in difficulty to Mr. Natural in Eldo, which is 5.8+, but it's slightly steeper.

Although short with only three bolts, Hot Spit is a hidden gem in the Flatirons. The overhung route starts with large huecos and gradually gets harder, ending with a challenging crux near the top.  Beautiful holds line entire route, especially the crimps at the crux.  Visiting Hot Spit is a great way to finish off a day of climbing at the nearby Overhang Wall or in the Dinosaur Mountain area.   Hot Spit is located on the west side of the Bubble.  The route is about a 5-10 minute walk down from the Drugs/Power Bulge area; 2-3 minute walk southeast of

Sneak Preview

; or 5-10 minutes up a gully beginning at Stonehenge at the base of Bear Creek. See also directions to the Bubble and/or Stonehenge.
content.protection: Three bolts to a two bolt anchor with rings for lowering.  Anchors showing some signs of rust.  No traditional protection needed.

content.description:
This another short, strenuous sport climb found on an overhanging WSW wall of the Bubble. Combined with

Hot Spit

,

Sneak Preview

,

Cloud Walker

,

Lucy & Devi Go Mousing

,

Drugs

,

Bidoigt

,

Rock & Roll

, and the hueco climbs of WSW Dinosaur Rock, you can find some gravitational challenges for the moderate climber in this vicinty.

Find this on the WSW face of The Bubble, which lies just West of North Dinosaur Egg. Approach via NCAR to the Mesa Trail, South to Bear Canyon Trail, up (North) the gully between the 2nd and 3rd strata.

The basic beta is sidepull, move feet up, repeat. OK, this may be boring perhaps, but the sidepulls vary. Taping your left Achilles and left 3rd & 4th fingers may be useful. This route climbs steeper than it looks. The crux is after the 3rd bolt involving small holds for liebacks. A stick clip is facile and perhaps useful. The 3rd piece of protection is a drilled angle, reminiscent of Garden of the Gods or the desert. It seems solid. The anchors are a pair of coldshuts. The rock is rough and fluffs up the rope when weighted on TR. Rap the route. It is 35 feet long.
content.protection: 3 QDs plus some slings for the anchors
